page.title: 18THE GRANTS OF RAMSBOTTOM
page.content: On the southern edge of our block is a public house in Ramsbottom Market Place called the Grant Arms. The building was once the home of William and Daniel Grant,who came from Speyside in Scotland to set up a textile business in 1773. They chose Ramsbottom as an ideal place,and in the course of the next ten years built up a successful business. The Grants became known as caring and generous employers,concerned with the welfare and education of their workers. They built local schools,churches,and good housing for them.Their fame as ideal employers spread far and wide,so much so that the author{Charles Dickens used them as the model for the kind-hearted Cheeryble Brothers in "Nicholas Nickleby".
